alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 26 at 7:58PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Additional snowfall accumulations up to 2 inches, with local amounts up to 4 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 60 MPH. * WHERE...In Wyoming, eastern Laramie County including Interstate 80 east of Mile Marker 380. In western Nebraska, Banner, Kimball, and Cheyenne Counties. This includes Burns, Carpenter, Pine Bluffs, Albin, Kimball, and Sidney. The highest amounts are expected between Kimball and Pine Bluffs. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and near-zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
